revision.text:
{{unreliable sources|date=September 2016}} {{Infobox military unit |unit_name= ''320. Infanterie-Division''
German 320th Infantry Division |image=[[Image:320th Infanterie-Division Logo 2.svg|100px]] |caption= |country= |allegiance= |type=[[Division (military)|Division]] |branch=[[German Army (Wehrmacht)|Heer]] |dates= 2 December 1940 – May 1945 |specialization=[[Infantry]] |command_structure= |size= |current_commander= |garrison= |ceremonial_chief= |nickname= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles=[[World War II]] |notable_commanders=[[Georg-Wilhelm Postel]] |anniversaries= }} The '''320th Infantry Division''' was created on 2 December 1940 in [[Lübeck]] from parts of the [[58th Infantry Division (Germany)|58th Infantry Division]] and [[254th Infantry Division (Germany)|254th Infantry Division]]. The Division was formally disbanded on 9 October 1944 and reformed as [[320th Volks Grenadier Division (Germany)|320th Volks Grenadier Division]]. ==Commanding officers== * Generalleutnant [[Karl Maderholz]] (15 December 1940 – 2 December 1942) * Generalleutnant [[Georg-Wilhelm Postel]] (2 December 1942 – 26 May 1943) * General der Infanterie [[Kurt Röpke]] (26 May 1943 – 20 August 1943) * Generalleutnant [[Georg-Wilhelm Postel]] (20 August 1943 – 10 July 1944) * Generalmajor [[Otto Schell]] (10 July 1944 – 2 September 1944) == References == * Wendel, Marcus (2004). "[http://www.axishistory.com/index.php?id=3898 320. Infanterie-Division]". * "[http://www.lexikon-der-wehrmacht.de/Gliederungen/Infanteriedivisionen/320ID.htm 320. Infanterie-Division]". German language article at www.lexikon-der-wehrmacht.de. Retrieved May 5, 2008. {{Infantry Divisions of the Wehrmacht}} {{Knight's Cross recipients of the 320th ID}} {{Subject bar | portal1=Military of Germany | portal2=World War II }} {{DEFAULTSORT:320th Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)}} [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1940]] [[Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1944]] [[Category:Infantry divisions of Germany during World War II]] {{Germany-WWII-stub}}
